alert.note: Alert for Western Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 20 at 7:48PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING... Generally less than an inch of snow is expected across the area, with localized amounts of 1 to 2" possible across the highest elevations, late tonight into Tuesday morning. Most snow accumulations should be on grassy and elevated surfaces due to the initially warm ground temperatures, but there is potential for untreated roads across the higher terrain and bridges and overpasses to become snow covered heading into the morning commute as air temps drop to around freezing. This could make for locally hazardous travel for the Tuesday morning commute. Snow will come to an end from west to east in the early to mid morning.
